400.description: Invalid domain name or lookup failed

get.summary: List all domains

post.description:
Creates a new domain and automatically requests a Let's Encrypt challenge.
You can specify the challenge type (HTTP-01 or DNS-01) in the request.

- **HTTP-01**: Validates domain ownership by placing a file on your web server at `/.well-known/acme-challenge/`
- **DNS-01**: Validates domain ownership by adding a TXT record to your DNS (required for wildcard domains)

get.summary: Get domain details by hostname
Get ACME order for a domain

post.summary: Create or recreate ACME order for a domain
post.description:
Creates a new ACME order with Let's Encrypt for the specified domain.
If an order already exists, you should cancel it first using the cancel-order endpoint.
Returns the challenge details that need to be fulfilled (DNS record or HTTP token).

delete.summary: Cancel ACME order for a domain
delete.description:
Cancels the current ACME order for a domain and clears all challenge data.
This allows you to start over with a new order if the previous one failed or got stuck.

post.summary: Finalize ACME order for a domain
post.description:
Finalizes the ACME order by completing the challenge validation and requesting the certificate.
This should be called after the challenge has been set up (DNS record added or HTTP token served).

post.summary: Setup DNS challenge records automatically using a DNS provider
post.description:
This endpoint automatically creates the required DNS TXT records for ACME DNS-01 challenge
validation using a configured DNS provider. The domain must have an active DNS challenge
pending (created via POST /domains/{id}/order with dns-01 challenge type).

This is similar to how email domain DNS records are auto-provisioned.

400.description: Bad request - DNS provider not configured or no challenge pending

404.description: Domain or DNS provider not found

get.summary: Get domain by ID
Get challenge token for a domain (returns plain text token)
Get HTTP challenge debug information
get.description:
Returns detailed debug information for HTTP-01 challenge including:
- Whether a challenge exists for the domain
- The challenge token and URL that Let's Encrypt will access
- DNS resolution information showing where the domain currently points

This is useful for debugging why HTTP-01 challenges fail.

get.summary: Tail logs for a specific deployment job in real-time via WebSocket
get.description:
**WebSocket Streaming**: Logs are sent as raw text, one line per WebSocket message.

**Authentication**: Requires authentication via session cookie (browser clients)
or API key (API clients). For browser-based WebSocket connections, ensure the user
is logged in - the browser automatically includes session cookies in the WebSocket
upgrade request.

**API Client Authentication**: Include API key in Authorization header:
```
Authorization: Bearer tk_your_api_key_here
```

101.description: WebSocket connection established for streaming deployment job logs

oneOf.description: Live challenge validation status fetched from Let's Encrypt

ActivityDay.description: Daily activity count for a single day

count.description: Number of deployments on this day

level.description:
Intensity level (0-4) for visualization
0: No activity, 1: Low (1-2), 2: Medium (3-5), 3: High (6-10), 4: Very High (11+)

ActivityGraphQuery.description: Query parameters for activity graph endpoint

days.description: Number of days to include (default: 365 for last year)

environment_id.description: Optional environment ID to filter activity

project_id.description: Optional project ID to filter activity

ActivityGraphResponse.description: Response for activity graph showing daily deployment activity

total_count.description: Total count of activities across all days

AddManagedDomainApiRequest.description: Request to add a managed domain

AggregatedBucketsQuery.description: Query parameters for aggregated metrics by time bucket

aggregation_level.description: Aggregation level: events, sessions, or visitors

bucket_size.description: Time bucket size: "1 hour", "1 day", "1 week", etc. (default: "1 hour")

end_date.description: End date for the query range

start_date.description: Start date for the query range

AppSettings.description:
Application settings stored in the database
All fields have sensible defaults for easy onboarding

default.content_security_policy: default-src 'self'; script-src 'self' 'unsafe-inline'; style-src 'self' 'unsafe-inline'; img-src 'self' data: https:; font-src 'self' data:; connect-src 'self'; frame-ancestors 'self'

AppSettingsResponse.description: Safe response for application settings that masks sensitive fields

AuditLogIpInfo.description: IP address information in audit log

AuditLogResponse.description: Response type for audit log entries

id.description: Unique identifier for the audit log entry

operation_type.description: The type of action that was performed

oneOf.description: User details who performed the action

user_id.description: The user who performed the action

AvailableContainerInfo.description: Available Docker container that can be imported as a service

exposed_ports.description: Exposed ports (e.g., [5432] for PostgreSQL, [6379] for Redis)

is_running.description: Whether the container is currently running

AvailablePermissions.description: Response containing all available permissions for frontend validation

permissions.description: All available permissions in the system

BuildConfiguration.description: Build configuration (for building images from source)

ChallengeConfig.description:
Challenge configuration (future feature)
For CAPTCHA, JS challenges, proof-of-work, etc.

validated.description: When the challenge was validated (if successful)

ContainerActionResponse.description: Response indicating success of container state change

ContainerDetailResponse.description: Detailed container information with environment variables and metrics

container_name.description: Optional container name to get logs from (if deployment has multiple containers)

timestamps.description: Include timestamps in log output (default: false)

memory_percent.description: Memory usage percentage (0-100) if limit is set

can_contain_containers.description: Can this container hold other containers?

can_contain_entities.description: Can this container hold entities (tables, collections, etc.)?

child_container_type.description: Type of child containers (if can_contain_containers is true)

container_type.description: Container type (database, schema, keyspace, bucket, etc.)

entity_count_hint.description: Hint for UI on expected entity count (small = sidebar, large = pagination)

entity_type_label.description: Label for entity type (if can_contain_entities is true)

CreateDnsProviderRequest.description: Request to create a new DNS provider

challenge_type.description: Challenge type for Let's Encrypt validation. Options: "http-01" (default) or "dns-01"

provider_id.description: Provider ID to use for this domain

oneOf.description: Scaleway credentials (required if provider_type is scaleway)
AWS SES credentials (required if provider_type is ses)

set_as_preview.description: If true, set this environment as the preview environment for the project

include_in_preview.description: Include this environment variable in preview environments (default: true)

CreateIpAccessControlRequest.description: Request to create an IP access control rule

ip_address.description: IP address in CIDR notation (e.g., "192.168.1.1" or "10.0.0.0/24")

CreatePlanRequest.description: Request to create an import plan

repository_id.description:
Optional repository ID to associate with the import
If provided, preset will be detected from the repository

can_execute.description: Whether the plan can be executed

exposed_port.description:
Port exposed by the container (fallback when image has no EXPOSE directive)

Priority order for port resolution:
1. Image EXPOSE directive (auto-detected from built image)
2. Environment-level exposed_port (overrides this value per environment)
3. This project-level exposed_port (fallback)
4. Default: 3000

Only set this if your image doesn't use EXPOSE directive.

oneOf.description:
Preset-specific configuration

Different presets accept different configuration options:
- **Dockerfile preset**: Accepts `DockerfilePresetConfig` with `dockerfile_path` and `build_context`
- **Nixpacks preset**: Uses `nixpacks.toml` file for configuration (no params needed)
- **Static presets** (Vite, Next.js, etc.): Accept `StaticPresetConfig` with build commands and output dir

Example for Dockerfile preset:
```json
{
  "dockerfilePath": "docker/Dockerfile",
  "buildContext": "./api"
}
```

route_type.description:
Route type: "http" (default) matches on HTTP Host header,
"tls" matches on TLS SNI hostname for TCP passthrough

endpoint.description: Optional endpoint URL for S3-compatible services like MinIO

force_path_style.description: Whether to use path-style addressing (default: true)

DeploymentConfig.description:
Deployment configuration shared between projects and environments

This configuration can be set at the project level (as defaults) and
overridden at the environment level for specific deployments.

Note: Environment variables are managed separately and are not part of this config.

automaticDeploy.description: Enable automatic deployments on git push

cpuRequest.description: CPU request in millicores (e.g., 100 = 0.1 CPU, 1000 = 1 CPU)

exposedPort.description:
Port exposed by the container
If not specified, will be auto-detected from Docker image or default to 3000

replicas.description:
Number of replicas/instances to run
Defaults to 1 replica

oneOf.description:
Security configuration (headers, rate limiting, attack mode, etc.)
These settings inherit and override from parent level (Environment > Project > Global)

DeploymentConfigSnapshot.description:
Deployment configuration snapshot for deployments

This extends DeploymentConfig with environment variables to capture
the complete state of a deployment at the time it was created.

automaticDeploy.description: Enable automatic deployments on git push

environmentVariables.description: Environment variables used for this deployment

DeploymentMetadata.description: Deployment metadata - typed information about the deployment

dockerfilePath.description: Dockerfile path if using Dockerfile builder

fileCount.description: Number of files in the build output

oneOf.description: Git push event that triggered this deployment (if from webhook)

imageSizeBytes.description: Total size of the built image in bytes

isRollback.description: Whether this is a rollback deployment

rolledBackFromId.description: ID of the deployment this was rolled back from (if applicable)

oneOf.description: Deployment configuration snapshot (CPU, memory, replicas, environment variables, etc.)
Deployment metadata (build info, git event, etc.)

DigestSections.description:
Sections that can be included in the weekly digest
Note: `#[serde(default)]` allows backward compatibility when deserializing
old data that may have `security` and `resources` fields instead of `projects`

DiskSpaceAlertSettings.description: Disk space alert settings for monitoring disk usage

check_interval_seconds.description: Interval in seconds between disk space checks

enabled.description: Whether disk space alerts are enabled

monitor_path.description: Path to monitor (defaults to data directory)

threshold_percent.description: Threshold percentage (0-100) at which to trigger alerts

DnsChallengeRecordResult.description: Result of a single DNS TXT record creation for ACME challenge

success.description: Whether the record was created successfully

value.description: TXT record value (the ACME challenge token)

DnsLookupError.description: Error response for DNS lookup failures

error.example: DNS lookup failed: domain not found

DnsLookupRequest.description: Request to lookup DNS A records for a domain

dns_servers.description: DNS servers used for the lookup

records.description: List of A record IP addresses

DnsProviderSettingsMasked.description: DNS provider settings with masked sensitive fields

name.description: Record name (without zone, e.g., "www" or "@" for root)

oneOf.description: A record - IPv4 address (as string, e.g., "192.0.2.1")

value.description: A record - IPv4 address (as string, e.g., "192.0.2.1")

oneOf.description: AAAA record - IPv6 address (as string, e.g., "2001:db8::1")

value.description: AAAA record - IPv6 address (as string, e.g., "2001:db8::1")

DnsRecordContent.description: DNS record content - varies by record type

status.description: Verification status: unknown, verified, pending, failed

DnsRecordSetupResult.description: Result of a single DNS record creation

automatic.description: Whether the operation was automatic or manual

success.description: Whether the record was created successfully

DnsZone.description: A DNS zone (domain managed by the provider)

DockerRegistrySettingsMasked.description: Docker registry settings with masked sensitive fields

DockerfilePresetConfig.description:
Configuration for Dockerfile preset
Allows customizing the Dockerfile path and build context for Docker-based deployments

buildContext.description:
Custom build context path (relative to repository root)
If not specified, uses the project's directory setting

dockerfilePath.description:
Custom Dockerfile path (relative to build context)
If not specified, defaults to "Dockerfile" in the build context

txt_records.description: Array of TXT records to add to DNS. For wildcards, multiple records are required.

certificate.description: The PEM-encoded certificate chain (can be displayed in browser or downloaded)

captured.description: Emails captured without sending (Mailhog mode - no provider configured)

sort_schema.description: JSON Schema for sort options (if supported)

EnvVarResponse.description: Environment variable with masked sensitive values

is_masked.description: Whether this is a sensitive/masked value

oneOf.description: Deployment configuration for this environment (overrides project-level config)

is_preview.description:
Indicates if this is a preview environment (auto-created per branch)
For preview environments, 'branch' contains the feature branch name

is_secret.description: Whether this is a secret (should be encrypted)

value.description: Variable value (may be redacted for secrets)

sensitive.description: Whether this variable contains sensitive data (passwords, keys, tokens)

include_in_preview.description: Include this environment variable in preview environments

data.description: Full error event data (contains raw Sentry event or custom error data)

referrer.description: Referrer URL (falls back to Referer header if not provided)

aggregation_level.description: Aggregation level: events (raw count), sessions (unique sessions), or visitors (unique visitors)

bucket_size.description: Bucket size: hour, day, or week (auto-detected if not specified)

aggregation_level.description: Aggregation level: events (raw count), sessions (unique sessions), or visitors (unique visitors)
Aggregation level: events (raw count), sessions (unique sessions), or visitors (unique visitors)

custom_events_only.description: Only return custom events, excluding system events like page_view, page_leave, heartbeat (default: true)

preset.description: Preset to use for the project (e.g., "nextjs", "express", "docker")

project_name.description: Project name to use (overrides the name from the plan)

filter_schema.description: JSON Schema for filter format with embedded UI hints (if supported)

reason.description: Reason why explorer is not supported (if applicable)

supported.description: Whether the service supports query explorer functionality

ExternalServiceBackupResponse.description: Response type for external service backup

GeoLocationResponse.description: Response containing geolocation information for an IP address

is_eu.description: Whether the IP is in the European Union

allowedCountries.description: Allow traffic only from specific countries

blockedCountries.description: Block traffic from specific countries (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 codes)

GitPushEvent.description: Git push event information that triggered the deployment

retries.description: Number of retries before marking unhealthy

HierarchyLevel.description: Describes a level in the data source hierarchy

can_list_containers.description: Can list containers at this level?

can_list_entities.description: Can list entities at this level?

container_type.description: Type of container at this level

aggregation_level.description: Aggregation level: events (page views), sessions (unique sessions), or visitors (unique visitors)

challenge_url.description: The full URL that Let's Encrypt will try to access to validate the challenge

dns_a_records.description: IPv4 addresses the domain points to

dns_aaaa_records.description: IPv6 addresses the domain points to

validation_url.description: The ACME validation URL (internal to ACME protocol)

ImportExternalServiceRequest.description: Request to import a Docker container as a managed service

container_id.description: Container ID or name to import

name.description: Name to register the service as in Temps

ImportPlan.description: Complete import plan describing all operations to onboard a workload

source.description: Source system this plan was generated from

status_filter.description: Filter by status (running, stopped, deployed, etc.)

workload_type_filter.description: Filter by workload type (container, function, static-site, etc.)

available.description: Whether the source is currently available

IpAccessControlQuery.description: Query parameters for listing IP access control rules

IpAccessControlResponse.description: Response model for IP access control rules

ListAuditLogsQuery.description: Query parameters for listing audit logs

limit.description: Maximum number of logs to return
Maximum number of entities to return

is_b2c.description: Whether the email provider is a B2C (consumer) email provider

is_disposable.description: Whether the email is from a disposable email provider

is_role_account.description: Whether the email is a role-based account (e.g., admin@, info@)

error.description: Error message if MX lookup failed

records.description: List of MX records for the domain

NixpacksPresetConfig.description:
Configuration for Nixpacks preset
Nixpacks auto-detects your application and uses nixpacks.toml for configuration
No additional parameters needed - configuration is expressed in nixpacks.toml file

PageHourlySessionsQuery.description: Query parameters for page hourly sessions endpoint

has_more.description: Whether there are more entities available

next_token.description: Continuation token for next page (S3, etc.)

platforms.description: List of supported platforms in "os/arch" format (e.g., ["linux/amd64"])

host_port.description: Host port (optional - can be assigned dynamically)

is_primary.description: Whether this is the primary HTTP port

oneOf.description: Configuration for Nixpacks preset (uses nixpacks.toml, no params needed)
Configuration for static site presets (Vite, Next.js, etc.)

PresetConfigSchema.description:
Union type for preset configurations
Use the appropriate configuration type based on your preset

exposed_port.description: Default exposed port for this preset

path.description: Path where preset was detected (empty for root)

default_port.description: Default port the application listens on (None for static sites)

description.description: Description of what this preset does

slug.description: Unique identifier slug for the preset

ProblemDetails.description:
Representation of a Problem error to return to the client.
Follows RFC 7807 - Problem Details for HTTP APIs

detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem
detail.example: The server encountered an unexpected condition

instance.description: A URI reference that identifies the specific occurrence of the problem

title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem type

type.description: A URI reference that identifies the problem type

example.title: Internal Server Error
example.detail: The server encountered an unexpected condition

is_web_app.description: Whether this is a web application

exposedPort.description: Default exposed port for this preset (e.g., 3000 for Next.js, 8000 for FastAPI)

attack_mode.description: Attack mode - when enabled, requires CAPTCHA verification for all project environments

enable_preview_environments.description: Enable automatic preview environment creation for each branch

PropertyBreakdownQuery.description: Query parameters for property breakdown (group by column)

end_date.description: End date for the query range

limit.description: Maximum number of results to return (default: 20, max: 100)

start_date.description: Start date for the query range

PropertyTimelineQuery.description: Query parameters for property timeline (group by column over time)

end_date.description: End date for the query range

start_date.description: Start date for the query range

branch.description: Branch name where presets were detected

PushImageRequest.description: Request to push an external image

limit.description: Maximum number of rows to return

returned_count.description: Number of rows returned in this response

total_count.description: Total number of rows matching the query (before limit/offset)

RateLimitConfig.description: Rate limiting configuration (subset of global RateLimitSettings)

blacklistIps.description: Blacklist specific IPs for this project/environment

whitelistIps.description: Whitelist specific IPs for this project/environment

s3_source_id.description: ID of the S3 source to store the backup

SecurityConfig.description:
Security configuration for projects and environments

This configuration can be set at three levels:
1. Global (in settings table) - applies to all projects
2. Project level - overrides global settings for specific project
3. Environment level - overrides project settings for specific environment

The inheritance chain: Environment > Project > Global

attackMode.description:
Attack mode configuration (future: "off", "challenge", "block")
Placeholder for DDoS protection, bot detection, etc.

oneOf.description: Challenge configuration (future: CAPTCHA, JS challenge, etc.)

enabled.description:
Enable/disable security features at this level
If None, inherits from parent level

SecurityHeadersConfig.description: Security headers configuration (subset of global SecurityHeadersSettings)

contentSecurityPolicy.description: Custom CSP (only used if preset is "custom")

content_security_policy.default: default-src 'self'; script-src 'self' 'unsafe-inline'; style-src 'self' 'unsafe-inline'; img-src 'self' data: https:; font-src 'self' data:; connect-src 'self'; frame-ancestors 'self'

from.description: Sender email address (domain will be auto-extracted for lookup)

ServiceAccessInfo.description: Response containing information about how the service is being accessed

can_create_domains.description: Whether domain creation is allowed in this mode

domain_creation_error.description: Error message if domain creation is not allowed

private_ip.description: Server's private/local IP address (always returned if available)

public_ip.description: Server's public IP address (always returned if available)

SetupDnsChallengeRequest.description: Request to setup DNS challenge records using a configured DNS provider

dns_provider_id.description: The ID of the DNS provider to use for creating the TXT records

SetupDnsChallengeResponse.description: Response from DNS challenge setup operation

records_created.description: Number of TXT records that were successfully created

results.description: Results for each individual TXT record

success.description: Overall success status (true if all records were created)

total_records.description: Total number of TXT records required for the challenge

SetupDnsRequest.description: Request to setup DNS records using a configured DNS provider

dns_provider_id.description: The ID of the DNS provider to use for creating records

records_created.description: Number of records that were successfully created

oneOf.description: Match specific channel (organic, paid, direct, referral, etc.)

value.description: Match specific channel (organic, paid, direct, referral, etc.)

SmartFilter.description: Smart filter presets for common funnel patterns

can_connect_smtp.description: Whether we could connect to the SMTP server

error.description: Error message if SMTP check failed

has_full_inbox.description: Whether the mailbox appears to have a full inbox

is_catch_all.description: Whether this is a catch-all domain

SourceBackupEntry.description: Entry in the source backup index

location.description: Location of the backup file in S3

metadata_location.description: Location of the backup metadata file in S3

size_bytes.description: Size of the backup in bytes

SourceBackupIndexResponse.description: Response type for source backup index

backups.description: List of backups in the source

last_updated.description: When the index was last updated

SpeedMetricsPayload.description: Speed metrics payload for recording web vitals

StaticPresetConfig.description:
Configuration for static site presets (Vite, Next.js, Docusaurus, etc.)
These presets build static sites that are served via a web server

buildContext.description:
Custom build context path (relative to repository root)
Useful for monorepo setups where the app is in a subdirectory

installCommand.description: Custom install command (overrides auto-detected package manager)

outputDir.description:
Custom output directory (overrides preset default)
Common values: "dist", "build", ".next", "out"

domain.description: The domain part of the email

is_valid_syntax.description: Whether the email syntax is valid

username.description: The username part of the email

TestEmailRequest.description: Request body for testing an email provider

from.description: Sender email address (must be verified with the provider)

error.description: Error message if the test failed

sent_to.description: The email address the test was sent to

success.description: Whether the test email was sent successfully

request_count.description: Total number of requests in this bucket

date.description: Date for which stats are returned

environment_id.description: Optional environment ID - if not provided, will use the project's preview environment
Environment ID to scan (uses the current deployment for this environment)

UniqueCountsQuery.description: Query parameters for unique counts over time frame

end_date.description: End date for the query range

metric.description: Metric to count: "sessions" (unique sessions), "visitors" (unique visitors), or "page_views" (total page views) (default: "sessions")

start_date.description: Start date for the query range

UpdateDnsProviderRequest.description: Request to update a DNS provider

automatic_deploy.description: Enable/disable automatic deployments for this environment

exposed_port.description:
Port exposed by the container (overrides project-level port for this environment)

Priority order for port resolution:
1. Image EXPOSE directive (auto-detected from built image)
2. This environment-level exposed_port (overrides project setting)
3. Project-level exposed_port (fallback)
4. Default: 3000

oneOf.description: Security configuration for this environment (overrides project-level settings)

docker_image.description:
Docker image to use for the service (e.g., "postgres:17-alpine", "timescale/timescaledb-ha:pg17")
When provided, the service will be recreated with the new image while preserving data

UpdateIpAccessControlRequest.description: Request to update an IP access control rule

attack_mode.description: Enable/disable attack mode (CAPTCHA protection) for all project environments

enable_preview_environments.description: Enable automatic preview environment creation for each branch

route_type.description:
Route type: "http" (default) matches on HTTP Host header,
"tls" matches on TLS SNI hostname for TCP passthrough

endpoint.description: Optional new endpoint URL for S3-compatible services

name.description: Optional new name for the source

UpdateSpeedMetricsPayload.description: Update speed metrics payload for late-loading metrics

docker_image.description:
Docker image to upgrade to (e.g., "postgres:17-alpine")
This will trigger pg_upgrade for PostgreSQL or equivalent upgrade procedures for other services

ValidateEmailRequest.description: Request body for validating an email address

email.description: The email address that was validated

is_reachable.description: Overall reachability status: safe, risky, invalid, or unknown

payload.description: JSON payload that was sent to the webhook endpoint

WorkloadDescriptor.description: Brief descriptor for discovered workloads (used in listing)

WorkloadId.description: Unique identifier for a workload in the source system

bearer_auth.description: Bearer token authentication. Use format: `Bearer <your-token>`. Supports API keys (starting with `tk_`), CLI tokens, and session tokens.

tags.name: Metrics
tags.description: Analytics metrics collection endpoints including performance web vitals

tags.name: Public Repositories
tags.description: Endpoints for accessing public repositories without authentication. Supports GitHub and GitLab.

tags.name: Webhook Deliveries
tags.description: Webhook delivery history and retry endpoints
